issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
This came up in a eutester nettest. Not sure if this is consistent/reproducible yet. I verified manually (shown below) with the frozen test. Will provide more info from the midonet portion(s). 
Thanks, 
-M

{code}
In [7]: ins = nt.group2_instances[0]

In [8]: ins
Out[8]: Instance:i-b8ad7a1f

...
...
### Check to see if instance's security group allows from this machine's ip (10.5.1.70) to tcp:22. It does not...
...
...

In [12]: tester.does_instance_sec_group_allow(instance=ins, protocol='tcp', port=22)
[2015-01-08 20:23:22,912] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:3027)Starting method: does_instance_sec_group_allow(self, src_addr=None, src_group=None, protocol=tcp, port=22)
[2015-01-08 20:23:22,912] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Using src_addr:10.5.1.70
[2015-01-08 20:23:22,912] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:3093)Starting method: does_sec_group_allow(self, group=SecurityGroup:net_tests_group2_1420776655.37, src_addr=10.5.1.70, src_group=None, protocol=tcp, port=22)
[2015-01-08 20:23:22,913] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Security group:net_tests_group2_1420776655.37, src ip:10.5.1.70, src_group:None, proto:tcp, port:22
[2015-01-08 20:23:23,751] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Found matching security group for name:net_tests_group2_1420776655.37 and id:sg-413cb27a
[2015-01-08 20:23:23,751] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: rule#0: ports:22-22, grants:172.31.1.152/32,

--->(ec2ops.py:3157)Starting method: is_address_in_network(, cls=<class 'eucaops.Eucaops'>, ip_addr=10.5.1.70, network=172.31.1.152/32)
[2015-01-08 20:23:23,752] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: sec_group:"net_tests_group2_1420776655.37" DOES NOT allow from: src_ip:"10.5.1.70", src_group:"None", proto:"tcp", port:"22"
Out[12]: False


...
...
#But it allows a connection anyways...
...
...

In [13]: ins.connect_to_instance()
[2015-01-08 20:23:47,150] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: Attempting to reconnect_to_instance:i-b8ad7a1f
[2015-01-08 20:23:47,835] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: reset_ssh_connection for:i-b8ad7a1f
[2015-01-08 20:23:47,835] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: Connecting ssh i-b8ad7a1f
[2015-01-08 20:23:47,835] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: SSH connection has hostname:10.116.169.85 user:root and keypath: /Users/clarkmatthew/Documents/python_workspace/eutester_qa/eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/net_tests_key_1420519355.75.pem
[2015-01-08 20:23:47,966] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: SSH connection attempt(1 of 3), host:'root@10.116.169.85', using ipv4:10.116.169.85, thru proxy:'None'
[2015-01-08 20:23:48,222] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: SSH - Connected to 10.116.169.85
[2015-01-08 20:23:48,222] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: Try some sys...
[2015-01-08 20:23:48,222] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: [root@10.116.169.85]# 
[2015-01-08 20:23:49,382] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: 

[2015-01-08 20:23:49,383] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: done with exec
[2015-01-08 20:23:49,383] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: [root@10.116.169.85]# ls /dev/vda
[2015-01-08 20:23:49,731] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: 
/dev/vda

[2015-01-08 20:23:49,990] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: done with exec

...
...
#Security group shows it should only allow ssh (tcp:22) from a single host '172.31.1.152/32', and icmp from anywhere...
...
...

In [17]: tester.show_security_group(ins.security_groups[0])
[2015-01-08 20:24:37,558] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Found matching security group for name:None and id:sg-413cb27a
[2015-01-08 20:24:37,562] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|              Security Group:net_tests_group2_1420776655.37/sg-413cb27a               |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| +-----------------+--------------+------------+----------+------+----------+-------+ |
| | CIDR_IP         | SRC_GRP_NAME | SRC_GRP_ID | OWNER_ID | PORT | END_PORT | PROTO | |
| +-----------------+--------------+------------+----------+------+----------+-------+ |
| | 172.31.1.152/32 |     None     |    None    |   None   |  22  |    22    |  tcp  | |
| +-----------------+--------------+------------+----------+------+----------+-------+ |
| | 0.0.0.0/0       |     None     |    None    |   None   |  -1  |    -1    |  icmp | |
| +-----------------+--------------+------------+----------+------+----------+-------+ |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+


...
...
#Validate that we connected to instance. Note, hostname bug is discussed in seperate ticket...
...
...

In [18]: ins.sys('hostname')
[2015-01-08 20:25:46,139] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: [root@10.116.169.85]# hostname
[2015-01-08 20:25:46,252] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: 
172

[2015-01-08 20:25:46,252] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: done with exec
Out[18]: ['172']

In [19]: ins.sys('ifconfig')
[2015-01-08 20:25:58,723] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: [root@10.116.169.85]# ifconfig
[2015-01-08 20:25:59,037] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: 
eth0      Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr d0:0d:d7:3e:1d:4b  

[2015-01-08 20:25:59,275] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]:           inet addr:172.31.0.238  Bcast:172.31.15.255  Mask:255.255.240.0

[2015-01-08 20:25:59,583] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]:           inet6 addr: fe80::d20d:d7ff:fe3e:1d4b/64 Scope:Link
          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1450  Metric:1

[2015-01-08 20:25:59,634] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]:           RX packets:372 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:368 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:1000 
          RX bytes:47332 (47.3 KB)  TX bytes:44311 (44.3 KB)

lo        Link encap:Local Loopback  
          inet addr:127.0.0.1  Mask:255.0.0.0
          inet6 addr: ::1/128 Scope:Host
          UP LOOPBACK RUNNING  MTU:16436  Metric:1
          RX packets:0 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:0 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0

[2015-01-08 20:25:59,748] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]:           collisions:0 txqueuelen:0 

[2015-01-08 20:25:59,799] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]:           RX bytes:0 (0.0 B)  TX bytes:0 (0.0 B)


[2015-01-08 20:25:59,799] [i-b8ad7a1f] [DEBUG]: done with exec
Out[19]: 
['eth0      Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr d0:0d:d7:3e:1d:4b  ',
 '          inet addr:172.31.0.238  Bcast:172.31.15.255  Mask:255.255.240.0',
 '          inet6 addr: fe80::d20d:d7ff:fe3e:1d4b/64 Scope:Link',
 '          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1450  Metric:1',
 '          RX packets:372 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0',
 '          TX packets:368 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0',
 '          collisions:0 txqueuelen:1000 ',
 '          RX bytes:47332 (47.3 KB)  TX bytes:44311 (44.3 KB)',
 '',

 '          inet addr:127.0.0.1  Mask:255.0.0.0',

 '']

In [20]: ins.private_ip_address
Out[20]: u'172.31.0.238'
{code}

Some additional info...

{code}
[root@c-39 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-b8ad7a1f
RESERVATION	r-73788fd9	935226775957	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37
INSTANCE	i-b8ad7a1f	emi-db84baee	10.116.169.85	172.31.0.238	running	net_tests_key_1420519355.75	0		m1.small	2015-01-09T04:12:14.614Z	one			monitoring-disabled	10.116.169.85	172.31.0.238	vpc-7b1bc189	subnet-1997adcc	instance-store					hvm			sg-413cb27a				x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-d73e1d4b	subnet-1997adcc	vpc-7b1bc189	935226775957	in-use	172.31.0.238	euca-172-31-0-238.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		0	attached	2015-01-09T04:12:14.616Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.169.85	eucalyptus	{'privateDnsName': 'euca-172-31-0-238.eucalyptus.internal', 'association': {'publicIp': '10.116.169.85', 'publicDnsName': 'euca-10-116-169-85.eucalyptus.localhost', 'ipOwnerId': 'eucalyptus'}, 'primary': 'true', 'privateIpAddress': '172.31.0.238'}
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	172.31.0.238	euca-172-31-0-238.eucalyptus.internal	primary
TAG	instance	i-b8ad7a1f	euca:node	10.111.5.70

[root@c-39 ~]# euca-describe-group sg-413cb27a
GROUP	sg-413cb27a	935226775957	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37	vpc-7b1bc189
PERMISSION	935226775957	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	172.31.1.152/32	ingress
PERMISSION	935226775957	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	935226775957	net_tests_group2_1420776655.37	ALLOWS	-1			TO	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	egress

[root@c-39 ~]# midocli -e  chain list | grep sg-413cb27a | xargs -l bash -c 'echo rules for:$3; midonet-cli -e chain $1 list rule; echo done'
rules for:sg_egress_sg-413cb27a
done
rules for:sg_ingress_sg-413cb27a
rule e20e8023-68f1-4e76-a852-96254eb63589 proto 6 tos 0 dst-port 22 fragment-policy header pos 1 type accept
rule 0daf6b21-ee57-4c04-a2c7-b54c4d28d047 proto 1 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 2 type accept
done





midonet> router list
router router0 name vr_vpc-7b1bc189_2 state up infilter chain0 outfilter chain1
router router1 name eucart state up
midonet> chain chain1 list rule
rule rule0 dst !172.31.0.2 proto 0 tos 0 ip-address-group-src ip-address-group0 fragment-policy any pos 1 type snat action continue target 10.116.169.42
rule rule1 dst !172.31.0.2 proto 0 tos 0 ip-address-group-src ip-address-group1 fragment-policy any pos 2 type snat action continue target 10.116.169.85


[root@c-39 ~]# midonet-cli 
midonet> router list
router router0 name vr_vpc-7b1bc189_2 state up infilter chain0 outfilter chain1
router router1 name eucart state up
midonet> chain chain1 list rule
rule rule0 dst !172.31.0.2 proto 0 tos 0 ip-address-group-src ip-address-group0 fragment-policy any pos 1 type snat action continue target 10.116.169.42
rule rule1 dst !172.31.0.2 proto 0 tos 0 ip-address-group-src ip-address-group1 fragment-policy any pos 2 type snat action continue target 10.116.169.85
midonet> router router0 list port
port port0 device router0 state up mac ac:ca:ba:d2:0f:d6 address 169.254.0.2 net 169.254.0.0/17 peer bridge0:port0
port port1 device router0 state up mac ac:ca:ba:3f:3d:a0 address 172.31.16.1 net 172.31.16.0/20 peer bridge1:port0
port port2 device router0 state up mac ac:ca:ba:86:a6:ee address 172.31.0.1 net 172.31.0.0/20 peer bridge2:port0
midonet> bridge bridge2 list 
dhcp  port
midonet> bridge bridge2 list 
dhcp  port
midonet> bridge bridge2 list port
port port1 device bridge2 state up
port port2 device bridge2 state up
port port3 device bridge2 state up infilter chain2 outfilter chain3
port port4 device bridge2 state up infilter chain4 outfilter chain5
port port0 device bridge2 state up peer router0:port2
midonet> chain chain2 list rule
rule rule0 proto 6 tos 0 dst-port 80 ip-address-group-dst ip-address-group2 fragment-policy unfragmented pos 1 type dnat action continue target 172.31.0.2:31337
rule rule1 proto 0 tos 0 flow return-flow fragment-policy any pos 2 type accept
rule rule2 proto 0 tos 0 flow fwd-flow ip-address-group-src ip-address-group0 fragment-policy any pos 3 type accept
rule rule3 ethertype !2054 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 4 type drop
midonet> chain chain3 list rule
rule rule0 src 172.31.0.2 proto 6 tos 0 src-port 31337 fragment-policy unfragmented pos 1 type snat action continue target 169.254.169.254:80
rule rule1 proto 0 tos 0 flow return-flow fragment-policy any pos 2 type accept
rule rule2 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 3 type jump jump-to chain6
rule rule3 ethertype !2054 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 4 type drop
midonet> chain chain4 list rule
rule rule0 proto 6 tos 0 dst-port 80 ip-address-group-dst ip-address-group2 fragment-policy unfragmented pos 1 type dnat action continue target 172.31.0.2:31337
rule rule1 proto 0 tos 0 flow return-flow fragment-policy any pos 2 type accept
rule rule2 proto 0 tos 0 flow fwd-flow ip-address-group-src ip-address-group1 fragment-policy any pos 3 type accept
rule rule3 ethertype !2054 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 4 type drop
midonet> chain chain5 list rule
rule rule0 src 172.31.0.2 proto 6 tos 0 src-port 31337 fragment-policy unfragmented pos 1 type snat action continue target 169.254.169.254:80
rule rule1 proto 0 tos 0 flow return-flow fragment-policy any pos 2 type accept
rule rule2 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 3 type jump jump-to chain7
rule rule3 ethertype !2054 proto 0 tos 0 fragment-policy any pos 4 type drop
midonet> ip-address-group ip-address-group1 list ip
address 172.31.0.238
midonet> ip-address-group ip-address-group2 list ip
address 169.254.169.254
midonet> ip-address-group ip-address-group0 list ip
address 172.31.1.152
{code}
fields.summary: (VPC) Security group allowing tcp/22 from outside allowed range.
fields.environment:
CLOUD GLOBAL:
ObjectStorage: "walrus"
ObjectStorage Endpoint: "uninitialized-s3-endpoint"
  10.111.5.100 CENTOS 6.6 64 REPO [UFS OSG CLC WS]

CLUSTER "one":
Network Mode:EDGE
EBS Backend:das
  10.111.5.71 CENTOS 6.6 64 REPO [CC SC]
  10.111.5.70 CENTOS 6.6 64 REPO [NC]

CLUSTER "two":
Network Mode:EDGE
EBS Backend:das
  10.111.5.147 CENTOS 6.6 64 REPO [CC SC]
  10.111.5.148 CENTOS 6.6 64 REPO [NC]

comments.body: Have verified in recent builds that the cidr blocks,  ports and protocols are now correctly mapped from the security group rules to midonet.
